promptImprover.intro: Research shows that iterative, dialogue-based refinement yields 20-50% better AI outputs compared to one-shot prompts, as it uncovers hidden assumptions and builds specificity organically.
promptImprover.title: The Prompt Improver: Stop Memorizing, Start Discussing.
promptImprover.description: Mastering AI isn't about learning complex prompt structures by heart. Based on the latest best practices, the key is *dialogue*. This tool demonstrates that principle: it helps you refine your prompt by discussing it with the LLM (powered by Google AI Studio), ensuring you both understand the goal, constraints, and context before execution. Try it below.
promptImprover.howItWorksTitle: How it Works: The System Instruction

notebookLM.title: NotebookLM: Content First, Formatting Later.
notebookLM.description: NotebookLM revolutionizes collaboration by shifting the focus. Stop worrying upfront about how the CFO wants data formatted versus the CEO. Focus on structure and input. Dump everything‚Äîtranscripts, PDFs, decks, links‚Äîinto a Notebook. NotebookLM becomes the central brain. You can then rapidly iterate and generate the exact presentation format needed for any stakeholder instantly.

flowVibe.title: Understanding Your New Powers: From 'Vibe' to 'Signal'
flowVibe.subtitle: A guide to mastering the evolution of AI interaction.
flowVibe.intro: The way we interact with AI is evolving. We started with conversational 'Vibe Coding,' got confused by the term 'Flow Coding,' and are now moving towards a more precise and powerful method: 'Signal Coding.' This guide is designed to help you master this evolution.

vibe.title: 1. Vibe Coding (The "Director" üé¨)
vibe.description: Fast, creative, and conversational. This is about giving the AI a general direction and iterating based on its output. It's like directing an actor‚Äîyou provide the 'vibe' and see what you get back.
vibe.exampleText: on this page uses Vibe Coding. You give it a rough idea, and it directs the AI to refine it.

flow.title: 2. The "Flow Coding" Confusion
flow.description: The term 'Flow Coding' is ambiguous. It can mean being in 'the zone,' using a Git Flow, building with visual tools like Google Agentspace, or just 'going with the flow.' Because it lacks a clear definition, it's not a useful concept for building reliable AI systems. We need something more precise.
flow.conclusion: Conclusion: 'Signal Coding' is a more useful concept.'

signal.title: 3. Signal Coding (The "Architect" üìê)
signal.description: This is the evolution. Instead of a 'vibe,' you provide a clear, structured 'signal.' Signal Coding is about giving the AI precise, repeatable, and testable instructions to build reliable, production-ready systems. It's the language of AI architects.
signal.workflow: Structured instructions, system prompts, defined inputs/outputs.
signal.goal: Create predictable, scalable, and reliable AI applications.
signal.power: Enables agentic workflows and complex, multi-step tasks.
signal.exampleText: uses Signal Coding. Its two-step process with specific system instructions is a clear 'signal' for a predictable outcome.

promptImproverHeader.title: Unlock the Magic: How to Master Your Prompts üöÄ
promptImproverHeader.paragraph1: LLMs are prediction engines. They generate the most likely next word based on your input. A vague prompt like "Tell me about AI" gives the model infinite directions to go‚Äîresulting in generic, unfocused output. But a specific prompt like "Write a 500-word blog post for developers explaining transformer architecture, using analogies and avoiding heavy math" gives the model clear guardrails.
promptImproverHeader.paragraph2: This tool uses a "baked-in" system instruction that acts as your expert Prompt Coach. Instead of teaching you theory, it asks the right questions to uncover gaps in your thinking‚Äîmissing context, unclear objectives, format requirements‚Äîand collaboratively builds a better prompt with you through guided dialogue.
promptImproverHeader.summaryText: Click to copy the 'Prompt Scribe' System Instruction
